desc: CEBPA encodes a basic region leucine zipper (bZIP) transcription factor that can homo- or heterodimerizes to bind DNA and activates transcription (PMID: 25753223). Through interactions by its transactivation domain, it can help recruit the RNA polymerase complex, coactivators CBP (Creb binding protein) /p300, and chromatin modifying complexes SWI/SNF (switch/sucrose nonfermentable) (PMID: 12857754, 14660596). CEBPA gene regulation is important for the differentiation of diverse cell types including hematopoietic, adiopose, liver and epithelial cells (PMID: 7652557, 23160954, 12757710). In lung cancer, CEBPA may suppress tumorigenesis (PMID: 17638888). In hematopoiesis, CEBPA is important for the development of the myeloid lineage and granulocytic differentiation by regulating specific growth factor receptors and cell cycle arrest (PMID: 25753223). CEBPA mutations are found in acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and in inherited AML predisposition syndromes (PMID: 11242107, 12351377, 25311743, 23560626).

desc: CEBPA encodes a transcription factor involved in proliferation arrest and differentiation. Mutations of CEBPA are found in leukemias.
